audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker introducing himself as "Chi World" and the topic of the video: Adobe Illustrator tutorials, specifically how to color an illustrator "like a boss". He states that he will get straight to the point, unlike others who "make you watch like five minutes into it" before getting to the point. The speaker then clarifies that he will jump right into it. He transitions into describing how to start the tutorial.

The clip opens with a male speaker confidently stating his intention to draw a "simple" but "dope" picture, emphasizing his natural talent. This is followed by a brief musical interlude featuring a hip-hop beat with an ominous tone. Suddenly, the speaker expresses surprise and shock, exclaiming, "What is that? Oh shit! What is that?" His tone becomes more defensive as he justifies the drawing by saying, "I know this ain't the best looking freezer in the world," explaining that the tutorial is about coloring. Then, he proceeds to instruct the listener to select everything and merge the lines together.

The audio clip starts with music playing in the background, possibly in a hip-hop style, setting a somewhat relaxed mood. Simultaneously, a male speaker begins to describe a design process, mentioning to "expand appearance", going "to your Pathfinder" and clicking "merge", and then states how the design has been unified. The speaker emphasizes the outcome, inquiring "You know what I'm saying?". The music continues quietly in the background throughout.

The audio begins with a male speaker explaining how he grabs a layer and drags it to a blank sheet to make a copy, emphasizing the locking of the top layer. He clarifies that this is to keep the line work layer on top when adding shadows, allowing shadows to fall underneath the line work, finishing with "You feel me?". After this speech, a brief fart sound effect is heard. The male speaker then continues, directing the listener to ensure the second layer is highlighted.

The audio clip starts with one male speaker advising how to pick a color to start out with, suggesting "a golden yellow" and mentioning to click the box and rectangle tool, then dragging it over the line work. The speaker continues describing a "pointer tool" and to click the color just made.

The audio clip begins with someone instructing to right-click, followed by directions to go to "arrange" and "send to the back". This person speaks in an instructional tone. Subsequently, there is a brief silence.

The audio clip features a single male speaker giving instructions, saying "after you send the color to the back of the line work", then further explaining the next steps to "highlight everything together" and "merge it together to make it one". He speaks in a calm, instructional tone. Concurrent with the speech, there is music playing in the background, which is hip-hop style and sets a relaxed, somewhat contemplative mood.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker providing instructions about using design software, mentioning actions like "remerge it," "click off of it," "right click onto it," and "isolate selected group." He emphasizes the importance of having everything closed off during line work. He then says, "look, you get... click each color by itself after you click isolated selected group." The tone is instructional and clear. The speaker then talks about deleting something and how using these techniques gets faster once mastered. Following that, R&B music starts playing, creating a chilled and somewhat melancholy atmosphere, featuring prominent synth melodies.

The audio clip begins with a single male speaker saying "Okay, now we finna color the eyes, so what we gonna do?". He then explains that he's going to select one eye, hold shift, and select the other eye "so we can have two things selected at once". The speaker continues stating, "Then we're gonna go to our color", and that he will "move it to whatever we want it to be once we find the color you want it to change to." The speaker has a casual and instructional tone.

The audio clip starts with an excerpt from a hip-hop track featuring prominent synth elements. A single male speaker then explains that "you want to lock that layer", as part of a tutorial process. The music continues faintly in the background while the speaker continues to explain how to add a new layer for shadows.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker mentioning adding a layer for highlights and saying "that'll be all she wrote". Next, there's an electronic hip-hop song playing, setting a chill mood. The music then stops, and the male speaker returns, this time summarizing a tutorial on coloring in Adobe Illustrator and asking listeners to like, comment, subscribe and thank them for watching. He concludes by announcing that more heat is coming soon and telling listeners to stay tuned.
